intro: Epidendrum cusii, commonly known as the Cusí orchid, is a species native to Central and South America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant features long, strap-like leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and relatively easy care requirements. Epidendrum cusii is part of the Epidendroideae subfamily, which includes many popular orchid genera.
